title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4.52 - Executive order no. 52: establishing the position of director of economic development
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4.52 - Executive order no. 52: establishing the position of director of economic development

State Regulations
WHEREAS, the development of a stronger, more productive
economy and the expansion of economic opportunity are among the highest
priorities of State government; and
WHEREAS, the attainment of these objectives requires the
concerted effort of many State agencies and authorities; and
WHEREAS, this effort can only be fully effective if it is
pursued as part of a coherent, clearly defined economic development
strategy; NOW, THEREFORE, I, Mario M. Cuomo, Governor of the State of

New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and laws
of the State of New York, do hereby establish the position of Director of

Economic Development. I. Powers and

Responsibilities

The Director of Economic Development shall: serve as chairperson of the Governor's Economic Development

Subcabinet, which shall include the Department of Agriculture and Markets, the

Office of Deputy Secretary for Economic Development, the Banking Department, the Battery Park City Authority, the Office of Business Permits and Regulatory

Assistance, the Department of Commerce, the Office of Contract Compliance and

Minority- and Women-Owned Business Enterprise, the Education Department, the

Energy Office, the Energy Research and Development Authority, the Department of

Environmental Conservation, the Insurance Department, the Job Development

Authority, the Department of Labor, the Port Authority of New York and New

Jersey, the Power Authority of New York, the Public Service Commission, the

Science and Technology Foundation, the Department of State, the State

University of New York, the Department of Taxation and Finance, the Department
of Transportation, the Urban Development Corporation, and such other agencies
as the Governor may designate; be responsible for formulating, in consultation with the

Governor, the State's overall economic development strategies, and for
supervision and direction of their implementation by the aforesaid entities of
the Economic Development Subcabinet; be responsible for supervising and directing the
formulation of the Governor's economic development programs, including any
budgetary or legislative proposals required to develop those programs; be responsible for overseeing the supervision, direction
and management of said economic development programs and projects, including
the Job Training Partnership Program, to assure their appropriate and timely
implementation and operation; be responsible for identifying and resolving interagency
issues that may arise between or among the said economic development entities
of the said subcabinet; and be the Governor's chief spokesperson in the area of
economic development. II. Provision of Resources and Information

The aforesaid entities of the Economic Development

Subcabinet shall provide the Director of Economic Development with such
assistance, information and resources as the director may require for the
effective discharge of his responsibilities; and the director may enter into
agreements with such entities as may be necessary for the effective discharge
of his responsibilities. Signed: Mario M. CuomoDated: November 8, 1984
[FN*] [Revoked by Executive Order No. 31 (George E. Pataki), infra.]
[FN[DAGGER]] [Revoked by Executive Order No. 5 (Eliot

Spitzer), infra.]
[Revoked by Executive Order No. 9 (David A. Paterson), infra.]
[Revoked by Executive Order No. 2 (Andrew M. Cuomo), infra.]
